io.storj

Class RedundancyScheme

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.storj.RedundancyScheme
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class RedundancyScheme
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Represents the redundancy scheme used for erasure encoding data on the network.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RedundancyScheme.Builder
      Builder for RedundancyScheme objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object o)
      Two RedundancyScheme objects are equal if their erasure encoding algorithm, number of required, repair, success, and total erasure shares, and erasure share size are all equal.
      RedundancyAlgorithm getAlgorithm()
      Returns the algorithm for erasure encoding.
      short getRepairThreshold()
      Returns the minimum number of safe erasure shares that can remain before a repair is triggered.
      short getRequiredShares()
      Returns the required number of erasure share to recover the original data.
      int getShareSize()
      Returns the size of the erasure shares.
      short getSuccessShares()
      Returns the desired total number of erasure shares for a segment.
      short getTotalShares()
      Returns the total number of erasure shares generated by the erasure encoding.
      int hashCode()
      The hash code value of RedundancyScheme is the hash code value of its erasure encoding algorithm, number of required, repair, success, and total erasure shares, and erasure share size.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
